business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end lower as year-end rally fizzlesThe BSE Sensex closed at 85,041.45, down 367.25 points or 0.43%, while the NSE Nifty50 settled at 26,042.30, lower by 99.80 points. The session remained volatile, with markets slipping after early stability as investors turned cautious at higher levels.

Is India's housing market entering a new phase of lower sales but higher value?Even though the number of homes sold declined, the overall value of housing sales increased by 6% year-on-year. The total sales value crossed Rs 6 lakh crore in 2025, up from about Rs 5.68 lakh crore in the previous year, mentioned report.

Explained: Why copper prices have hit a record highThe rally is not the result of a single trigger. Instead, it reflects a powerful mix of rising demand, tight supply and supportive global conditions that have reshaped the copper market.

Why are Swiggy, Zomato and Amazon gig workers going on strike on December 31?The strike has been announced by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union along with the Indian Federation of App-Based Transport Workers.

Wonder drug for male baldness puts Swiss firm Cosmo's shares on steroidsStrong trial data has rewritten Cosmo's prospects, but the real test lies ahead as regulators, partners and patients decide whether this promising science can truly deliver commercial success globally eventually.

Sensex tumbles over 400 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 1:02 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 386.20 points to 85,022.50, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 106.80 points to trade at 26,035.30. Most of the broader market indices were also trading in negative territory as volatility rose during the session.

Hindustan Copper shares at 15-year high: What's driving the rallyThe stock has been one of the standout performers in the metal space, and Friday's move reflects a mix of strong commodity trends and sustained investor interest.

Made a mistake in your ITR? Here's how many times you can still revise itIf you think filing your income tax return locks everything in, that is not entirely true. The tax department recognises that genuine mistakes can happen and allows taxpayers to revise their returns, provided they act within the allowed time window.

How will insurance industry trends create new opportunities in 2026?Powered by artificial intelligence, rising climate risks, and changing customer expectations, the insurance industry is now silently transforming itself. Some of the trends that we may see in 2026 could look very different from what most people expect today.

Gold, silver extend record rally: Should you buy now?With gold anchoring portfolios and silver leading returns, should investors keep adding exposure, or step back and wait as record prices test discipline and long-term allocation strategies?

Is India's real estate market entering a more mature and institutional phase?Forces such as digitisation, institutional capital and changing consumer preferences reshaped the sector. More than just building structures, real estate is now about creating ecosystems that are interoperable with transit, logistics, digital infrastructure and services.

What happens if you do not file a revised ITR after your refund is put on holdWhen a return is flagged under the risk management framework, the refund does not move forward on its own. If a taxpayer does not revise the return or respond to the issue flagged, the refund can remain on hold indefinitely, even if the claim is otherwise genuine.

RVNL share price zooms over 11% today. What investors need to knowAt around 10:32 am, the RVNL share price was trading 11.01% higher at Rs 383.75 on the BSE, making it one of the top-performing public sector stocks during the session.

IRFC shares jump over 7% today. Here's what's driving the rallyAt around 10:32 am, IRFC shares were trading 7.42% higher on the BSE at Rs 130.50, emerging as one of the top gainers among public sector stocks during the session.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

Eggs on the boil: Why prices are high and when they might coolEgg prices reflect a market resetting after years of strain, where higher costs, cautious supply, and steady demand mean consumers should expect easing, not a return to cheap eggs soon.

Why Dalal Street's Santa rally failed to take off this yearWhat began as a tentative Santa rally faded quietly, leaving benchmark indices range-bound and investors asking why seasonal cheer failed to translate into sustained gains. Read on to find out what it means for Dalal Street investors.

Sensex, Nifty slip at open as Dalal Street rally loses momentumAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 95.26 points at 85,313.44, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 40.80 points to trade at 26,101.30. Broader markets also traded in the red, with volatility ticking up during early trade.

Why are egg prices crossing Rs 8 in many Indian cities this winter?Eggs, often seen as one of the most affordable sources of protein, are turning expensive in many Indian cities this winter. As prices move past Rs 8 per piece, consumers are keen to understand what is pushing rates higher.

Revised or belated ITR? What taxpayers should file before December 31With the December 31 deadline fast approaching, many taxpayers are unsure whether they need to file a revised or a belated income tax return. Recent alerts from the income tax department have made it even more important to understand the right option.

entertainment.headline: Mahesh Babu takes a break from shoots to celebrate cosy Christmas at home Mahesh Babu and Namrata Shirodkar celebrated Christmas with their family and friends. The actor paused his busy filming schedule to join loved ones at home in Hyderabad.

Did you know Leonardo DiCaprio's stepmother is Sikh? Hollywood superstar Leonardo DiCaprio recently opened up about his stepmother being Sikh, surprising many fans. The revelation has sparked widespread interest across India.

Sharmila Tagore recalls Saif and Ness Wadia's school-time antics and PTA meetings Sharmila Tagore shared memories of frequently attending her son Saif Ali Khan's school due to his frequent mischief. The veteran star talked about finding the balance between work and parenthood back then.

Bangladesh lynching: Kajal Aggarwal to Jaya Prada, celebs condemn Dipu Das' killing Indian celebrities demand action and solidarity after the mob lynching of a Hindu factory worker in Bangladesh, raising concerns for minority safety as authorities make arrests and deny blasphemy evidence.

Watch: Thalapathy Vijay holds speaker for Malaysian dancers as they welcome him Thalapathy Vijay was warmly welcomed by Malaysian dancers ahead of the audio launch of his upcoming film, Jana Nayagan. The grand event marks his last event as an actor before entering full-time politics.
Preity Zinta shares cosy family Christmas celebration with husband Gene, twins Preity Zinta shared pictures from her Christmas celebration featuring husband Gene Goodenough and their twin children.

Aamir Khan Productions announces Sitaaron Ke Sitaare documentary on YouTube Aamir Khan Productions announced a YouTube documentary titled 'Sitaaron Ke Sitaare'. The special documentary offers a touching glimpse into the lives of parents.

Rajat Kapoor confirms return in Drishyam 3, says his character has no arc Rajat Kapoor will return as Mahesh Deshmukh in Drishyam 3, playing the grieving father of a deceased son. He shared that his character has "no arc" and mainly stays behind Tabu's character.

Dhurandhar enters Rs 1000-crore club: A look at films that crossed the milestone Aditya Dhar's spy thriller 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has surpassed all industry forecasts by reaching the Rs 1000 crore mark at the box office within 21 days of its release. The film has become the top-grossing movie of 2025.

Rekha meets Big B's grandson Agastya, hugs him in old viral video amid Ikkis buzz An old video from the RK Film Festival featuring Rekha and Agastya Nanda has gained attention once again as Agastya prepares for the release of Ikkis.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi beats Anupamaa to top ratings chart Ektaa Kapoor's Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi has surpassed Anupamaa to become the most-watched television show this week. Last week, Bigg Boss 19 grand finale was the No.1 show.

Anirudh flies to Malaysia for audio launch of Vijay's Jana Nayagan: One last dance Music composer Anirudh, while speaking to the media before leaving for Malaysia for Jana Nayagan audio launch, said he was excited to perform in front of a huge crowd on Thalapathy Vijay's 'one last dance'.

Suniel Shetty-Mana celebrate 43rd anniversary with granddaughter Evaarah in frame Suniel Shetty celebrated 43 years of marriage with Mana Shetty by sharing a family photo featuring their granddaughter Evaarah Vipula Rahul.

Martin Scorsese calls Rob Reiner's death an obscenity, recalls friendship Martin Scorsese reflected on his friendship and professional relationship with Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, after their deaths. The director offered personal insights and honoured their legacy in a guest essay published on Christmas.

Deepika Padukone's fans slam Dhruv Rathee for skin-lightening claims in new video Dhruv Rathee's recent video about Bollywood celebrities and alleged skin-lightening treatments drew sharp reactions from Deepika Padukone's fans online. The post came after he criticised Dhurandhar as a propaganda cinema.

Dhurandhar enters Rs 1,000 crore club in record time, tops 2025 Indian box office Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar has entered the Rs 1,000 crore club worldwide within just 21 days of release, becoming the highest-grossing Indian film of 2025 and surpassing the global lifetime collection of Kantara Chapter 1.

How Salman Khan plans to ring in 60th birthday on December 27: Exclusive info Source says that Salman Khan's 60th birthday plans reportedly include the customary party on December 27 for near and dear ones at Panvel farmhouse, and a very special video for the superstar

Irrfan shot Angrezi Medium in severe pain, says costume designer: He was ailing Costume designer Smriti Chauhan has shared how Irrfan continued shooting Angrezi Medium despite intense pain and deteriorating health, requiring constant costume adjustments for comfort.

Avatar Fire and Ash becomes 2025's biggest Hollywood hit in India, tops F1 Avatar: Fire and Ash box office Week 1 report: James Cameron's film has become the biggest Hollywood grosser of 2025 in India, surpassing F1 in just seven days.

general news.headline: India condemns Hindu man's lynching in Bangladesh: Perpetrators must be punishedThe government on Friday condemned the lynching of Hindu men in Bangladesh this month. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal stressed that those responsible for the attacks must be held accountable.

Canada hospital killed him: Next to Indian-origin man's body, wife narrates ordealStanding beside the body of her husband lying on a bed, she can be seen blaming Grey Nails Hospital for the untimely demise of her husband just at the age of 44 years.
Caused hardships to people: India says actively engaging with US on H-1B delaysDelay in H-1B visa process caused extended hardships to people, raised issue with US: Government

Fear of Op Sindoor 2.0? Panicked Pakistan rushes anti-drone systems to LoCIntelligence inputs indicate fresh installations of counter-unmanned aerial systems (C-UAS) opposite the Rawalakot, Kotli and Bhimber sectors amid growing anxiety within the Pakistan army of a Sindoor redux.

Will India hand over Sheikh Hasina? History shows even a partridge wasn't betrayedProtecting someone who has sought refuge, even by sacrificing their own life, has been a civilisational ethos of Indians. Those demanding that India hand over Sheikh Hasina should be told how 200 people gave their lives to shield an injured partridge in Gujarat's Muli. From Jam Sataji and Hamir Dev Chauhan to India sheltering the Dalai Lama, this is a dharma that Indians have taken pride in and stayed true to.

Unnao rape survivor's family, activists protest at court; cops ask them to leaveUnnao rape case: Protesters were stopped from demonstrating outside the Delhi High Court, leading to a brief exchange with court security. Security personnel told them protests are not allowed at the court gate and asked them to move.

14 injured in Japan factory after stabbing, liquid spray attack; suspect in custodySeveral people were stabbed by a man with a knife at a rubber factory in the city of Mishima, in Shizuoka prefecture west of Tokyo, according to Kyodo News Agency.

BJP breaks four-decade barrier, wins Thiruvananthapuram Mayor's postThe BJP has made a historic breakthrough in Kerala by securing its first-ever mayoral post in Thiruvananthapuram, ending nearly 40 years of Left dominance. This victory signals a significant shift in the state's local political landscape.

Wonder drug for male baldness puts Swiss firm Cosmo's shares on steroidsStrong trial data has rewritten Cosmo's prospects, but the real test lies ahead as regulators, partners and patients decide whether this promising science can truly deliver commercial success globally eventually.

Anti-Indian Trump ally refers to Dipu Das's lynching, warns of Islamists in USAnti-India right-wing activist and Trump ally Laura Loomer referred to the lynching of Dipu Chandra Das, a Hindu garment factory worker in Bangladesh, to warn about the spread of Islamist ideology within the US. Loomer warned that similar incidents would become commonplace in the US unless lawmakers took decisive action.

DRDO facility, tech park: How politician-builder nexus tried to destroy AravallisAravalli row: A significant portion of the Aravallis falls in Haryana, and over the years, successive governments have tried to hand over large swathes of land to builders and corporates. Here's a look at the instances.

Live: Trinamool MP seeks PM's intervention over attacks on Hindus in BangladeshBangladesh Violence Live Updates: A Hindu man has been beaten to death in Bangladesh, the second such killing in days, heightening concerns over the safety of religious minorities in the country. Local media reported that 29-year-old Amrit Mondal, also known as Samrat, was attacked and killed in Rajbari's Pangsha sub-district late on Wednesday night, around three-and-a-half hours from Dhaka. The killing follows the lynching of Dipu Chandra Das, whose body was set on fire earlier this week. The latest incident coincides with the return of senior opposition leader Tarique Rahman to Bangladesh after 17 years in self-imposed exile, as he pledged to ensure safety and justice if his party wins next year's elections. Stay with IndiaToday.com for live updates

When some in NDA sought Vajpayee's exit, Mamata stood like a rockSome within the NDA flirted with the idea of moving beyond Atal Bihari Vajpayee and running a government without him after he lost the no-confidence motion in 1999. However, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee and the MDMK's Vaiko made it clear there would be no NDA without Vajpayee at the helm, recalls the ex-PM's media advisor Ashok Tandon.

Bangladesh: What Tarique Rahman's plan signals for India and HindusBangladesh: Tarique Rahman, delivering his first speech in Bangladesh in 17 years, invoked Martin Luther and said, 'I have a plan'. Through his speech and previous statements, Tarique has given glimpses of what his plan holds for Bangladesh, Hindus and India.

Udaipur rape-accused CEO's IT firm rated itself 4.7/5 on women friendlinessA female manager of an IT firm in Rajasthan Udaipur has accused her CEO Jeetesh Sisodia, executive head Shilpa Sirohi and her husband Gaurav of gangraping her after a birthday party earlier this month.

High Court bats for Australia-like law banning social media for children below 16Australia, on December 10, became the first country in the world to ban social media for children under 16, a decision welcomed by many parents and child rights groups.

Deepika Padukone's fans slam Dhruv Rathee for skin-lightening claims in new videoDhruv Rathee's recent video about Bollywood celebrities and alleged skin-lightening treatments drew sharp reactions from Deepika Padukone's fans online. The post came after he criticised Dhurandhar as a propaganda cinema.

Why are Swiggy, Zomato and Amazon gig workers going on strike on December 31?The strike has been announced by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union along with the Indian Federation of App-Based Transport Workers.

Suicide bid at Mecca Grand Mosque, hero security guard breaks man's fallA suicide attempt at Masjid al-Haram in Makkah was foiled after Saudi security personnel swiftly intervened, preventing a fatal fall; the officer suffered fractures during the rescue.

Dhurandhar enters Rs 1,000 crore club in record time, tops 2025 Indian box officeAditya Dhar's Dhurandhar has entered the Rs 1,000 crore club worldwide within just 21 days of release, becoming the highest-grossing Indian film of 2025 and surpassing the global lifetime collection of Kantara Chapter 1.
Tsunami with energy equal to 23,000 atomic bombs: What happened in 2004?The disaster gave rise to global tsunami warning networks, saving countless lives since, as seen in Japan's 2011 Tohoku event.

Udaipur IT firm CEO, female executive, husband offer lift to colleague, rape herUdaipur Police arrested a private firm's CEO, a senior executive and her husband after a female staff alleged gang rape in a moving car, with medical reports and dashcam footage backing complaint.

Delhi woman says Bengaluru should be India's national capital. Internet reactsA woman from Delhi has sparked a conversation online after sharing her experiences comparing Bengaluru and Delhi, highlighting issues of air quality, safety, and infrastructure.

What happens if you do not file a revised ITR after your refund is put on holdWhen a return is flagged under the risk management framework, the refund does not move forward on its own. If a taxpayer does not revise the return or respond to the issue flagged, the refund can remain on hold indefinitely, even if the claim is otherwise genuine.

sports.headline: England greats blame MCG pitch after Ben Stokes's men implode on 20-wicket Day 1 AUS vs ENG, 4th Test: England greats Alastair Cook and Stuart Broad slammed the MCG pitch as unfair after 20 wickets fell on a bowler-dominated Day 1 of the Boxing Day Ashes Test.

Magnus Carlsen on facing young rivals like D Gukesh: Don't know how good they may be Magnus Carlsen and D. Gukesh discuss generational shifts and the impact of artificial intelligence in chess ahead of the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championship.

Rs. 7 Cr buy Venkatesh Iyer could miss RCB Playing XI? Kumble's explosive take Anil Kumble said that Venkatesh Iyer won't be a guaranteed starter for RCB despite them buying the Madhya Pradesh all-rounder for Rs. 7 Crore. Iyer is all set for a new chapter with RCB after moving from KKR.

Vidarbha's Dhruv Shorey equals record for most consecutive List A hundreds Vidarbha batter Dhruv Shorey scripted his name alongside N Jagadeesan in the List A record books after smashing his fifth consecutive century, an unbeaten 109 off 77 balls, against Hyderabad in the Vijay Hazare Trophy in Rajkot.

Mumbai's Angkrish Raghuvanshi rushed to Jaipur hospital after nasty injury Mumbai batter Angkrish Raghuvanshi was rushed to the hospital after suffering a nasty injury while fielding in the Vijay Hazare Trophy during the Mumbai vs Uttarakhand match.

Rohit bounces back with brilliant slip catch after first-ball duck in Jaipur Rohit Sharma was dismissed for a golden duck but took a sharp catch at first slip in the Vijay Hazare Trophy fixture against Uttarakhand. Mumbai recovered strongly to post 331/7 as Hardik Tamore top scored with 93*.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi honoured with Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar In this news report, India Today's Nitin Srivastava details the moment 14-year-old cricketer Vaibhav Suryavanshi received the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar from President Droupadi Murmu. The reporter highlights that this prestigious honour comes just days after the 'explosive young batter' smashed a record-breaking 190 runs for Bihar in domestic cricket. Srivastava notes that Vaibhav has 'captured the nation's attention' not only with his batting style but also by earning India's highest civilian honour for children. The segment positions him as a future icon of Indian cricket.

Babar Azam endures yet another failure on Boxing Day at Big Bash League Babar Azam's struggles in the Big Bash League continued on Boxing Day as the Pakistan star fell for 2 again, recording his third single-digit score in four matches for the Sydney Sixers.

Rajesh Mohanty becomes 1st Odisha bowler to take List A hat-trick Odisha fast bowler Rajesh Mohanty delivered a historic performance, becoming the first player from the state to claim a List A hat-trick. His early strikes set the tone for a dominant Odisha display, restricting Services to 83.

Australia's Michael Neser savours 'dream come true' Boxing Day masterclass Michael Neser starred with both bat and ball in his long-awaited Boxing Day Ashes debut at the MCG, leading Australia to a 46-run first-innings lead after a dramatic day that saw 20 wickets fall.

T20 World Cup-bound Rinku Singh signals rich form with quickfire 106 for UP Rinku Singh stayed in strong form in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, scoring an unbeaten 106 for Uttar Pradesh and building momentum ahead of India's upcoming T20I series against New Zealand.

20 wickets tumble on Boxing Day as England's Ashes horror continues Ashes 2025–26: England's batters failed to build on the good work done by their bowlers as 20 wickets fell in a single day for the first time in 124 years in the Ashes. The visitors ended the opening day on the back foot at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

Manchester City owners explain decision to cut ties with Mumbai FC amid ISL fiascoCity Football Group, which owns several top clubs worldwide, including English Premier League giants Manchester City, has explained its decision to pull out of its association with Mumbai City FC amid uncertainty over the future of the Indian Super League.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Pant's sublime 70 guides Delhi to 254 against GujaratRishabh Pant played a brilliant innings, scoring 70 as Delhi posted 254 against Gujarat in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Vishal Jayswal's four-wicket haul troubled Delhi batters.

Dhurandhar in Ashes? Fans joke Ben Stokes, Brendon McCullum are New Zealand spiesAshes 2025-26: Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum are being humorously labelled as New Zealand spies amid England's poor Ashes performance. The viral memes highlight fan frustration and raise questions about England's preparation and conduct during the series.

Australia's Pat Cummins targets T20 World Cup return after Ashes cameoAustralia captain Pat Cummins says he is "cooling his heels a little bit" as he targets a return at next year's ICC T20 World Cup, following his comeback in the third Ashes Test in Adelaide after a back injury ruled him out of the opening two matches.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi conferred National Children's Award by President MurmuVaibhav Suryavanshi was honoured with the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar award today by the President of India, Droupadi Murmu, in New Delhi.

Josh Tongue ends England's 27-year wait before record MCG crowd on Boxing DayAshes, Boxing Day Test: Josh Tongue starred with a five-wicket haul as England bowled out Australia for 152 on Day 1 at the MCG. His performance ended a 27-year wait for an England five-for at the venue.

Virat Kohli hits rapid 77 in Bengaluru after Rohit Sharma's golden duck in JaipurVirat Kohli scored 77 runs against Gujarat in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26. Despite a strong start, he missed out on his second successive century in the tournament.

No show: Rohit Sharma out for 0 in Jaipur, disappointed fans leave stadiumRohit Sharma was dismissed for a golden duck in the Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Uttarakhand. The early wicket left fans disappointed after they braved the winter morning cold to fill the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur.

Special Report: Ashish Limaye's Historic Asian Gold and Jitu Virwani's Vision for Indian EquestrianIn this special report, India Today explores the resilience of Indian equestrian sports amidst administrative crises. Ashish Limaye, the first Indian to win an individual gold at the Asian Equestrian Championships, describes his victory as 'a dream come true' and 'unbelievable'. The report highlights the pivotal role of Jitu Virwani, Chairman of Embassy Group, whose Embassy International Riding School (EIRS) in Bengaluru has become a cradle for champions like Limaye and Fouaad Mirza. Despite the Equestrian Federation of India (EFI) facing infighting and a split Junior National Equestrian Championship, private initiatives like EIRS are ensuring the sport's future. Virwani shares his vision of making the sport 'affordable and accessible' to create a legacy of champions.

Vijay Hazare Trophy live score: Raghuvanshi rushed to hospital, Kohli out for 77Vijay Hazare Trophy live: Rinku Singh has slammed a splendid century for UP guiding them to a massive score of 367. Meanwhile, Virat Kohli continued his rich form, scoring 77 for Delhi.

Trivandrum triumph a foregone conclusion? India eye series win vs toothless Sri LankaIND-W vs SL-W, 3rd T20I: Harmanpreet Kaur's side have dominated the five-match T20I series so far, winning both matches in Vizag and now looking to carry that momentum into Trivandrum.

Harmanpreet on the cusp of history, set to surpass Meg Lanning's major recordHarmanpreet Kaur is one win away from becoming the most successful T20I captain in history. She will surpass Meg Lanning to occupy the top of the list with another victory against Sri Lanka.

2026 beckons: Can Rinku Singh finally boss India's T20I middle order?Rinku Singh hasn't enjoyed the best run in T20 cricket over the past couple of years, but a solid campaign at next year's T20 World Cup could prove to be a game-changer for him in the shortest format.

Rohit Sharma's lookalike? Meet Hardik Tamore, Mumbai player who has gone viralRohit Sharma returned to the Vijay Hazare Trophy with a scintillating hundred against Sikkim. A moment from the game involving Rohit and Mumbai keeper Hardik Tamore went viral on the internet.

How Embassy Riding Club and Ashish Limaye are reshaping equestrian in IndiaAshish Limaye's Asian gold medal marks a turning point for Indian equestrian sport. Private initiatives like Embassy Riding School are vital amid federation challenges to nurture future talent.

Kartik Sharma on Rs 14.2 crore IPL deal: First, I'll repay my father's loansYoung Kartik Sharma fetched a massive sum of Rs 14.20 crore from Chennai Super Kings in the IPL auction. Sharma revealed how he wanted to spend his money.

Deepti Sharma recovers, but is Jemimah Rodrigues fit? India coach shares an updateIND vs SL: India Women are monitoring Jemimah Rodrigues' minor fitness issue ahead of the third T20I against Sri Lanka, while Deepti Sharma's return gives the team management a selection headache.

BPL 2026: Noakhali Express boycott training, coaches charge out of ground in angerNoakhali Express found themselves at the centre of a controversy in the 2026 Bangladesh Premier League (BPL) when coaches Khaled Mahmud Sujon and Talha Jubair stormed out of the ground in frustration over inadequate training facilities in Sylhet.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
